para.text: The Collection Editor is used for managing a list of child elements for a specific element.

Shows collections (a list of child elements contained in the current element) contained in the element by tabs. Different types of elements have different collections, and therefore have different tabs. For example, Class element has tabs for Attributes and Operations. The Relations tab is always present regardless of the element type.

Shows a list of the child elements. Select an element here and edit it using the property editor, documentation editor, and attachment editor in the inspector area. For showing element stereotype, visibility/stereotype, etc., please refer to the section on General Configurations, in Environment Configurations.
Creates a new element and adds it to the list. This button may connect existing elements instead of creating a new element (e.g. Residents, DeployedComponents, RaisedSignals).
Deletes the selected element in the collection element list. This button may remove the element from the list instead of deleting it (e.g. Residents, DeployedComponents, RaisedSignals).
Moves the selected element up in the collection element list.
Moves the selected element down in the collection element list.
The Constraint Editor is used for managing the constraints for elements.
Shows the names and contents of the constraints for elements.
Adds a new constraint to the element. This button opens the Constraints dialog box.
Deletes the selected constraint in the constraints list.
Edits the selected constraint in the constraints list.
Moves the selected constraint up in the constraints list.
Moves the selected constraint down in the constraints list.
This is used for adding a new constraint or editing the name and/or contents of existing constraints in the Constraint Editor. Enter the name of the constraint in the
field and enter the contents of the constraint in the
field. The user may freely enter any contents or write in the UML OCL (Object Constraint Language).
The Tagged Value Editor is used for editing the tagged values that can be added to specific elements.

By default, tagged values are defined in profiles. If there is a profile that contains the tagged values which can be applied to the currently selected element, it is shown as a tab. The tag definitions defined in the profile are displayed in the
Shows the tag definition set that can be applied to the currently selected element. The tagged values included in this set are displayed in the
Lists the definitions and their values included in the tag definition set selected in
. The user may directly change the values.
Every tag definition has a default value. Select a tag definition in
and click this button to clear the changed value and set it back to the default value.
The Profile Manager can be used for including or excluding the UML profiles for the current project.
Shows a list of the UML profiles registered for use in
. Profiles currently in use by the current project are not shown here.
Shows a list of the UML profiles in use by the current project.
Toggles the profile list icon size between large and small. Select the Small Icon Button if the profile names are only partially shown and difficult to read.
Includes the profile selected in the available profile list for use by the current project.
Excludes the profile selected in the included profile list so that it is no longer used by the current project.
The Add-In Manager can be used to view a list of the installed Add-Ins and to enable or disable the Add-Ins.
Shows a list of the installed Add-Ins. The user can check or uncheck each item to enable or disable the respective Add-In.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The list of Add-Ins in the Add-In Manager window may vary according to the user’s installation environment.

para.text: The Select New Project dialog box provides various selection methods when creating a new project. The New Project dialog box consists of three pages: Select Approach, Open Existing File, and Open Recent File.
The user can apply a specific approach for creating a new project.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Approaches

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : The approaches list displays the names and icons of the registered approaches. Select the “Empty Project” item if no approach is needed.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Large Icon/Small Icon Button:

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: This toggles the icon size for the approach list. Select the small icon button if the approach names are shortened and difficult to read.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Description: This area shows a brief description of the approach item selected from the list.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Use the selected Approach by default :

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Select an approach from the list and check this check box to set the approach as the default approach. The default approach is applied when creating a new project by selecting the
[File] -> [New] -> [New Project]

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: menu.

para.text: The user can open a previously created file. The tree view on the left shows the user system’s folder structure, and the file list area on the right shows the project files in the selected folder. Select a file from this file list and click the
button to open the selected file.
The user can see a list of the recently edited files and open them.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Recently modified files

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Shows a list of the recently edited files.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:70px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Remove non-existent files from the list

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Checks for files that no longer exist and removes them from the recent files list.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:70px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Clear the recent files list

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Clears all the files in the recent file list. The recent file list in the system registry is deleted.

para.text: The Import Framework dialog box allows the user to select an available framework and load it to the current project.
The frameworks list displays the names and icons of the registered frameworks. Select a framework to load.
This toggles the icon size for the framework list. Select the small icon button if the framework names are shortened and difficult to read.
This area shows a brief description of the framework item selected from the list.
The Page Setup dialog box allows the user to specify what and how diagram information is printed, the paper orientation, margins, outlines, etc.
The user can specify some of the diagram information to be printed.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: On Header : Prints the diagram information in the page header.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: On Footer : Prints the diagram information in the page footer.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: None : Does not print the diagram information.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Diagram Name : Prints the diagram name.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Project Title : Prints the project name of the diagram.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Page Number : Prints the page number.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Diagram Kind : Prints the diagram kind.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Date/Time :Prints the current date and time.

para.text: The user can specify the top, bottom, left, and right page margins in millimeters.
The user can specify whether to print the page in portrait or landscape.
The user can specify how the page border will be printed. Select top, bottom, left, or right for drawing border and specify the border thickness.
The Print dialog box appears when the user prints a diagram. The user can select and specify various options related to printing.
The user can configure the printer-related options.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Name : Select a printer to use from the installed printers.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Status : Indicates the status of the selected printer.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Location : Indicates the location of the selected printer.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Page Setup : Opens the Page Setup dialog box.

para.text: Specifies the size of the diagram to print.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Diagram as is : Prints the diagram in its original size. The diagram is printed in multiple pages if it does not fit in one page.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Fit to page : Prints the diagram to fit in one page. This option prevents printing of multiple pages if the diagram is large.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Tile : Prints the diagram to fit in multiple pages. The user can specify the number of pages to print by width and height (e.g. 3 pages wide and 4 pages tall = total 12 pages).

para.text: Specifies the range of the diagram to print.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Current diagram : Prints only the currently active diagram.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: All diagrams : Prints all of the diagrams in the current project.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Selected diagrams : Prints only the selected diagram. The
[Select All]

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: button selects all diagrams, and the
[Deselect All]

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: button deselects all diagrams.

para.text: The Print Preview dialog box allows the user to preview the print result before actually printing the diagram.
Toggles preview by one page or two pages.
Allows navigation to the first page, previous page, next page, and last page.
The user can move to a specific page by directly entering the page number.
The Find dialog box allows the user to find elements quickly and easily.
Enter the full or partial string for the element to find. The user can also select from the previously entered strings.

This specifies the range of elements to find. Available ranges: ‘All elements’, Model, Subsystem, Package, Class, Interface, Enumeration, Signal, Exception, Component, Node, Instance, UseCase, and Actor.
This specifies lowercase or uppercase for the element to find.
The Verify Model dialog box is used to inspect the model elements and their definitions.
Shows the verification rule currently being applied.
Shows the name of the element currently being verified.
Visually displays the progress of the verification.
Indicates the number of the elements that failed the verification.
The Options dialog box lists the various option items for environment configuration of
and allows the user to edit them.

This list shows the option categories. The top category is “Environment” which contains the sub-categories “General”, “Diagram”, “General View”, and “Specific View”. Additional option categories may be present depending on the module of
Shows the option items contained in the selected option category. The option values can be edited.
Shows a brief description of the selected option category or item.
Sets the selected option item value to the default value.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:19px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Reverts the selected option item value to the last saved value.
The Select Stereotype dialog box appears when the user needs to specify a stereotype for the selected element. The stereotype can be entered directly or selected from the list.
The user can directly enter the stereotype. If a stereotype has been registered, it is indicated in the stereotype list.

Shows the stereotypes defined in the UML profiles that are in use by the current project. The name of the stereotype and the name of the project that contains it are shown together. The user can select a stereotype from the list.
The icon is shown if the selected stereotype is associated with an icon.
Shows the description for the selected stereotype.

The Select Element dialog box allows the user to select an element from the hierarchical structure of the project elements. The Select Element dialog box appears when the user needs to assign an element at the property editor, collection editor, etc. Unlike the Element List dialog box, the Select Element dialog box lists the elements in a hierarchical structure.
The dialog box title changes according to the type of the element to be selected. An appropriate title is displayed for defining the attribute type, or the object type (i.e., Classifier).
Shows the available elements. For example, only the StateMachine elements are displayed when selecting a StateMachine element.

Shows the available data types. The data types shown here are those defined in the UML profiles which are in use by the current project. This list may not be shown if a data type does not need to be specified.
Check this to specify nothing. This actually assigns a null value.
The bottom part of the dialog box shows the full pathname of the selected element. This information can be used to verify which element is currently selected.

The Element List dialog box allows the user to select an element from a list. The Select Element dialog box appears when the user needs to assign an element to a specific property at the property editor, collection editor, etc. Unlike the Select Element dialog box, the Element List dialog box lists the elements in a one-dimensional list.
The dialog box title changes according to the type of the element to be selected. An appropriate title is displayed for selecting a StateMachine, or for assigning a component in a node.
Shows the available elements. For example, only the StateMachine elements are displayed when selecting a StateMachine element.
Check this to specify nothing. This actually assigns a null value.
The Model Filter dialog box can be used to show or hide specific elements in the model explorer.
Shows all the elements that can be displayed in the model explorer. Only those checked are displayed in the model explorer.
Transition, Dependency, Association, AssociationClass, Generalization, Link, AssociationRole, Stimulus, Message, Include, Extend, and Realization
Selects the elements set as default by the program.
